title: What else is there to be discovered? - Quora

response.answer_text: See, this is Exactly the Problem with modern day Society. There’s Too much complacency and Ignorance. Everyone just accepts what they are told and No One Questions Anything. We need to start Questioning more, and accepting less. A Child repeatedly asks, “Why?” He’s Not truly interested in Why, he just wants a better explanation. It’s a test of Parent’s Patience. We need to start asking, “But Why?” more often. With the intention, of discovering Real answers. If you know and Understand REAL Science, then you would realize there’s a Fleet load of things to discover. Exotic materials is one subject. AntiGravity is another. The list is nearly endless. Start by getting a proper education in the Sciences: Physics, Chemistry, Electricity, Materials, etc. Hint: Electrical voltage at a specific frequency alters the atomic structure of a material, leading to new, previously unknown substances. Get Busy! Materials science - Wikipedia Higgs boson - Wikipedia

Well let’s just say that this whole world is an inner reflection of you and this system we live is all interconnected. There are laws to this reality but what are they? All the problems in the world are due to our disparity of form with these laws yet you hold the key to uncover these laws deep within you and be apart of the process as an active component. Yes there is much to discover on the outside but for you my friend there is a whole world underneath what you see and it still needs to be discovered. What is the purpose of my life and where do I fit in to this galactic process.

Mankind has come a long way with discoveries and innovations since the beginning of our time on earth. Can you show me how much humans still have to learn and discover? If anyone knew what we have to learn and discover, then we would know about it and have discovered it, wouldn’t we?

All of that stuff in countless fields about which we do not yet know? Yes, that is yet to be discovered. Those things in fields which have been explored, but which in fact we can discover in a completely new light? This too has yet to be discovered. The stuff we’re sure about? For all I know we’ve got a few things to learn there as well. In other words, everything. Discovery doesn’t come to an end. To say otherwise is insulting to the imagination.

Did you know that almost 85% of the “known” universe is actually totally unknown. I am not talking about what’s in far away planets/stars/galaxies, 85% of the universe does not interact with any form of electromagnetic waves which means we cannot see it with visible light, infrared, x-rays or any technology we know of. We call it dark matter/dark energy cos we can’t even invent a name to describe it. We know it is there because of its gravitational waves and we don’t Really understand how those work… so based on that, event if if we knew everything there Ian to know about our “visible” universe, we would only know about 15% of everything… makes you think doesn’t it?

Who knows? How can anyone know what hasn’t been discovered? We only find these things out after they’ve been discovered. If someone knows about it, then it’s discovered. Only stuff that nobody knows about is undiscovered… So, nobody knows what else there is to be discovered. If you ask a question, and nobody knows the answer, you’ve just discovered something.
Well you are right we have discovered a lot but humans have to still learn the basics of living a life and discover how to unlearn discovery of cast, creed, Sex and religion.
